name: Season League Leaders 2004-05 Quiz | NBA by Season | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who led the league in total points?
questions.explanation:
Allen Iverson.

	Iverson of Philadelphia, won his scoring (PPG) title with a 30.7 average. He scored 2,302 in 75 games.

questions.text: Ben Wallace had led the league in rebounds per game twice coming into the season. What place did he finish in for the season?
options: He did not play enough games to qualify
questions.explanation:
2nd.

	Wallace, who played for Detroit played in 74 games and averaged 12.2 boards per contest. He second to Kevin Garnett(Minnesota) in rebounds per game, and behind Garnett and Shawn Marion(Phoenix) in total rebounds.

questions.text: Who led the league in three-point attempts?
questions.explanation:
Quentin Richardson.

	Hoiberg(Minnesota) led the league in three-point percentage. Korver(Philadelphia) and Richardson(Phoenix) tied to for the league lead in three-point shots made.

questions.text: Who had the most triple-doubles in the season?
questions.explanation:
Jason Kidd.

	Kidd(New Jersey) had eight, Bryant(Los Angeles Lakers) five, Webber(Sacramento/Philadelphia) and James(Cleveland) four each, Paul Pierce(Boston) and Damon Stoudamire(Portland) had two, and seven other players each had one.

LeBron James.

	Iverson(Philadelphia), who almost always played the most minutes, finished behind James(Cleveland) in both total minutes and minutes per game. James averaged 20 seconds more per game than Iverson.

questions.text: This category is not something anyone wants to lead the league in. Who led the league in turnovers?
questions.explanation:
Allen Iverson.

	Iverson(Philadelphia) had 344 tunrovers in 75 games. Wade(Miami) had 321 in 77 games.

questions.text: Who was at the top of the leaderboard in blocked shots?
questions.explanation:
Marcus Camby.

	Camby(Denver) played in only 66 games, but still had more blocks than anyone else. Wallace(Detroit) finished second in the league in both rebounds and blocks.

questions.text: Who was the league's best thief on a per game basis?
questions.explanation:
Larry Hughes.

	Hughes and Arenas were teammates in Washington averaging a combined 4.63 steals per game.

questions.text: Who in the league led in free throw percentage?
questions.explanation:
Reggie Miller.

	Miller(Indiana), who retired after the season, led the league making .933 percent of his free throws. He missed only 18 of the 268 he took.

questions.text: With the highest shooting percentage yet, who led the league in field goal percentage?
questions.explanation:
Shaquille O'Neal.

	Shaq(Miami) was the only player in the league to make more than 60 percent of his shots making 60.1 percent. He was also one of only five players to attempt 1,000 shots and make at least 50 percent of them.
